edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption

Class ScDamgardJurikEnc

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.asymmetricCrypto.encryption.ScDamgardJurikEnc
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc, AsymmetricEnc, DamgardJurikEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel

    public class ScDamgardJurikEnc
extends java.lang.Object
implements DamgardJurikEnc
    Damgard Jurik is an asymmetric encryption scheme based on the Paillier encryption scheme. This encryption scheme is CPA-secure and Indistinguishable.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey,
          java.security.PrivateKey privateKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initializes this DamgardJurik encryption scheme with (public, private) key pair. After this initialization the user can encrypt and decrypt messages.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be DamgardJurikPublicKey.
        privateKey - should be DamgardJurikPrivateKey.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given keys are not instances of DamgardJurik keys.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(java.security.PublicKey publicKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Initializes this DamgardJurik encryption scheme with public key. Setting only the public key the user can encrypt messages but can not decrypt messages.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        publicKey - should be DamgardJurikPublicKey
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key is not instance of DamgardJurikPublicKey.

      • encrypt

        public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
        This function performs the encryption of he given plain text
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - MUST be an instance of BigIntegerPlainText.
        Returns:
        an object of type BigIntegerCiphertext holding the encryption of the plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If the given plaintext is not instance of BigIntegerPlainText. 2. If the BigInteger value in the given plaintext is not in ZN.

      • generateEncryptionRandomness

        Returns:

      • encrypt

        public AsymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plainText,
                           java.math.BigInteger r)
        Encrypts the given plaintext using this asymmetric encryption scheme and using the given random value.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the encryption, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when more than one value is being encrypt. Instead, we decided to have an additional encrypt value that gets the random value from the user.

        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        r - The random value to use in the encryption.
        plainText - MUST be an instance of BigIntegerPlainText.
        Returns:
        an object of type BigIntegerCiphertext holding the encryption of the plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If the given plaintext is not instance of BigIntegerPlainText. 2. If the BigInteger value in the given plaintext is not in ZN.

      • decrypt

        public Plaintext decrypt(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher)
                  throws java.security.KeyException
        Decrypts the given ciphertext using DamgardJurik encryption scheme.
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        cipher - has to be an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext.
        Returns:
        Plaintext the decrypted cipher
        Throws:
        java.security.KeyException - if the Private Key has not been set for this object.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if cipher is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext.

      • generateBytesFromPlaintext

        public byte[] generateBytesFromPlaintext(Plaintext plaintext)
        Generates a byte array from the given plaintext. This function should be used when the user does not know the specific type of the Asymmetric encryption he has, and therefore he is working on byte array.
        Specified by:
        generateBytesFromPlaintext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - to generates byte array from. MUST be an instance of BigIntegerPlainText.
        Returns:
        the byte array generated from the given plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of BigIntegerPlainText.

      • reRandomize

        public AsymmetricCiphertext reRandomize(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher)
        This function takes an encryption of some plaintext (let's call it originalPlaintext) and returns a cipher that "looks" different but it is also an encryption of originalPlaintext.

        The given ciphertext have to has been generated with the same public key as this encryption's public key.

        Specified by:
        reRandomize in interface DamgardJurikEnc
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If cipher is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext. 2. If the BigInteger number in the given cipher is not in ZN'.

      • reRandomize

        public AsymmetricCiphertext reRandomize(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher,
                               java.math.BigInteger r)
        This function takes an encryption of some plaintext (let's call it originalPlaintext) and returns a cipher that "looks" different but it is also an encryption of originalPlaintext. It uses the given BigInteger random value.

        The given ciphertext have to has been generated with the same public key as this encryption's public key.

        Specified by:
        reRandomize in interface DamgardJurikEnc
        r - The random source to use in the function.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If cipher is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext. 2. If the BigInteger number in the given cipher is not in ZN'.

      • add

        public AsymmetricCiphertext add(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                       AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2)
        Given two ciphers c1 = Enc(p1) and c2 = Enc(p2) this function return c1 + c2 = Enc(p1 +p2). Both ciphertext have to have been generated with the same public key as this encryption's public key.
        Specified by:
        add in interface AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc
        Returns:
        the addition result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If one or more of the given ciphertexts is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext. 2. If the sizes of ciphertexts do not match. 3. If one or more of the BigInteger numbers in the given ciphertexts is not in ZN'.

      • add

        public AsymmetricCiphertext add(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher1,
                       AsymmetricCiphertext cipher2,
                       java.math.BigInteger r)
        Given two ciphers c1 = Enc(p1) and c2 = Enc(p2) this function return c1 + c2 = Enc(p1 +p2).

        Both ciphertext have to have been generated with the same public key as this encryption's public key.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the function, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when the add function is called more than one time. Instead, we decided to have an additional add function that gets the random value from the user.

        Specified by:
        add in interface AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc
        r - The random value to use in the function.
        Returns:
        the addition result
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If one or more of the given ciphertexts is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext. 2. If the sizes of ciphertexts do not match. 3. If one or more of the BigInteger numbers in the given ciphertexts is not in ZN'.

      • multByConst

        public AsymmetricCiphertext multByConst(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher,
                               java.math.BigInteger constNumber)
        This function calculates the homomorphic multiplication by a constant of a ciphertext

        in the Damgard Jurik encryption scheme.

        Specified by:
        multByConst in interface AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc
        Parameters:
        cipher - the cipher to operate on.
        constNumber - the constant number by which to multiply the cipher.
        Returns:
        the multiplication result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If the given cipher is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext. 2. If the BigInteger numbers in the given ciphertext is not in ZN'. 3. If the constant number is not in ZN.

      • multByConst

        public AsymmetricCiphertext multByConst(AsymmetricCiphertext cipher,
                               java.math.BigInteger constNumber,
                               java.math.BigInteger r)
        This function calculates the homomorphic multiplication by a constant of a ciphertext in the Damgard Jurik encryption scheme.

        There are cases when the random value is used after the function, for example, in sigma protocol. In these cases the random value should be known to the user. We decided not to have function that return it to the user since this can cause problems when the add function is called more than one time. Instead, we decided to have an additional add function that gets the random value from the user.

        Specified by:
        multByConst in interface AsymAdditiveHomomorphicEnc
        Parameters:
        cipher - the cipher to operate on.
        constNumber - the constant number by which to multiply the cipher.
        r - The random value to use in the function.
        Returns:
        the multiplication result.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no public key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in the following cases: 1. If the given cipher is not an instance of BigIntegerCiphertext. 2. If the BigInteger numbers in the given ciphertext is not in ZN'. 3. If the constant number is not in ZN.

      • generateCiphertext

        @Deprecated
public AsymmetricCiphertext generateCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Deprecated. As of SCAPI-V1-0-2-2 use reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Generates (reconstructs) a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Specified by:
        generateCiphertext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.generateCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)

      • reconstructCiphertext

        public AsymmetricCiphertext reconstructCiphertext(AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable AsymmetricCiphertext from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this is NOT in any way an encryption function, it just receives ENCRYPTED DATA and places it in a ciphertext object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructCiphertext in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - contains all the necessary information to construct a suitable ciphertext.
        Returns:
        the AsymmetricCiphertext that corresponds to the implementing encryption scheme, for ex: CramerShoupCiphertext
        See Also:
        AsymmetricEnc.reconstructCiphertext(edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.ciphertext.AsymmetricCiphertextSendableData)

      • reconstructPublicKey

        public java.security.PublicKey reconstructPublicKey(KeySendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable PublicKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PublicKey object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructPublicKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        a new PublicKey with the data obtained as argument

      • reconstructPrivateKey

        public java.security.PrivateKey reconstructPrivateKey(KeySendableData data)
        Description copied from interface: AsymmetricEnc
        Reconstructs a suitable PrivateKey from data that was probably obtained via a Channel or any other means of sending data (including serialization).

        We emphasize that this function does NOT in any way generate a key, it just receives data and recreates a PrivateKey object.

        Specified by:
        reconstructPrivateKey in interface AsymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        data - a KeySendableData object needed to recreate the original key. The actual type of KeySendableData has to be suitable to the actual encryption scheme used, otherwise it throws an IllegalArgumentException
        Returns:
        a new PrivateKey with the data obtained as argument
